Blurb: This release contains changes to eventually allow deploying to a webpage.
This is the first version of the application to deploy in WASM and be accessible externally. Stan and I will rapidly iterate from here.
This version includes bug fixes, a new changelog viewer in the Help mode, and tweaks to the Welcome screen.
This version includes an initial implementation of Pep/9.
This version includes improved debugging features and improved tab management.
This version focuses on improving the new user experience for Pep/9, and was the first version demo'ed to current students.
This version focuses on fixing issues discovered during the student demos.
This version introduces pre-built installers for desktop (Windows, Mac OS, Ubuntu) platforms.
This version adds separate builds for x86 and arm64 for Mac OS.
This version primarily focuses on notarization improvements for Mac OS for x86.
This version simplifies project creation, improves the debugger's symbol table, and introduces a new default font.
This version re-orders Pep/10 opcodes to group all AAA-type together.
This version redefines figures from chapter 7.
This version includes improved debugging features, including a watch expressions pane in the debugger.
This version adds conditional breakpoints and a UI to manage them.
This version fixes bugs around symbol tables and conditional breakpoints.
This version improves the layout of the debugger mode, improves focus management for text editors, and enables hotkeys/shortcuts in ISA3 projects
This version introduces a new method of laying out the editor and debugger
This version makes minor changes to macro formatting
This version adds a CLI tool to assemble and run microcode programs
This version includes various macro formatting fixes and Mac OS integrations
This version modifies the Pep/10 process control block and fixes Mac OS file saving
This version improves integration with Windows
This version streamlines the about dialog and includes minor Windows installer fixes
This version introduces a revised help system with additional information on how to use this application
This version improves visibilty of changes in non-visible project UI components
This release contains the necessary subset of features to support Chapter 4 of Computer Systems, sixth edition.
This release contains minor visual improvements for the "Welcome" mode
This release fixes a CTD on Windows platforms without a MSVC++ redistributable already installed
This release contains the necessary subset of features to support the Asmb3 figures in Chapter 5 of Computer Systems, sixth edition
This release improves the user experience for editing and debugging Asmb3 programs
This release enables the Asmb5 level assembler and simulator
This release improves Asmb5 projects to support Chapter 6 of Computer Systems, sixth edition
This release prevents a crash-to-desktop on malformed user programs
This version adds a command-line RISC-V simulator capable of simulating most C programs
This version continues work on the RISC-V simulator
